name: City.js
body:
### City.js
Demo of a random, procedurally-generated cityscape (work-in-progress).

## Demo

[Click here for the demo](http://htmlpreview.github.com/?https://github.com/shaper-pmp/city.js/blob/master/index.html), served straight out of the GitHub repo trunk.

## Latest changes

* Per-face textures, and a (crappy, placeholder) lighted windows texture
* Buildings are now generated from 1-3 CubeGeometry "parts", for more varied designs (not just monolithic slabs - now we have *architecture*!).
* Buildings' parts are now also off-centred within each block (by random values proportionate to the dimensions of the part), for more visually-interesting, asymmetrical buildings.
* Rudimentary street-light geometry.
* Mousewheel zoom, as well as the old click+drag rotation.
* Very simple lighting (one DirectionalLight).

## Known bugs

* Textures are correctly calculated for the first part of each building, but don't appear to be recalculated for each subsequent part, leading to stretching/compressing instead of desired fixed-size tiling effect.
* Graphical glitches when two or more building parts exactly share a vertical/horizontal plane.

## Future plans

* Improve procedurally generated random textures.
* White lines on road.
* Better streetlight models, and add downward-pointing SpotLights to each.
* Helicopters with spotlights tracing spline-curve pathways over city, to show off three.js's dynamic lighting.
* Cars (as agents) tracing their own randomly-selected paths through city... perhaps even with collision-avoidance for more realistic behaviour?
* Some sort of "grand tour" mode, which moves the camera on a randomly-generated spline-curve pathway through the city, diving between buildings, rotating around a specific one, pulling out/up/back for a broader view, etc.
